choices.B: Add statuses for all the pending sales stages
choices.D: Configure the solution to automatically convert leads to opportunities
choices.C: Set all new leads to a default status of Qualified

on exam

a. Begin quantity. Enter the minimum quantity a customer should purchase to be eligible for the discount.

b. End quantity. Enter the maximum quantity for which the discount is applicable.

c. Percentage or Amount. Enter the percentage or the amount of discount the customer will receive.

"Discount Lists" can have two types, Percent or Amount. "Discounts" require you to select a discount type base off the Discount List you are adding it to. Quantity 10 relates to "end quantity" of the first alumni discount tier ($2 discount amount). Quantity 20 relates to End Quantity of Tier 2 ($4 discount amount). 42??? Discount List type= amount. I would argue all discount types are amounts. Horrible question.

discussion.content:
Pricing methods are tied to price lists NOT Discount Lists. 
Alumni:$35=Current Cost=10% markup. Answer=Markup - Current
Non Alumni: $50=Standard rate= 12% margin. Answer= Margin - Standard
1b-2b corretto
1b-2b corretto
1b-2b correct

Standard Cost + Percentage margin - (Non-alumni ticket purchases are priced based on the standard rate.)
Current Cost + Percentage Markup - (Alumni ticket purchases are priced at the current cost.)
In exam, Jun-22
FOR ALUMNI , it should be current cost(both markup and margin are provided as per the problem statement) , for non -alumni it is standard cost with percentage margin

Alumni info given state basis is current cost, but show both markup and margin. Do we simply pick one arbitrarily? Non-alumni info given state standard cost and show margin, so answer should be C for Q2.
